New Records: Jackson Chourio became the youngest player to hit a leadoff homer in the postseason.
Chourio hit two home runs in the game, tying the game in the eighth and later giving the Brewers the lead with a two-run shot.
Key Match Events: The Brewers tied the game in the eighth inning with Chourio's second homer, setting up Mitchell's decisive two-run shot.
The Mets took the lead after a critical error by the Brewers' pitcher, leading to a five-run outburst.
Post-Match Reflections: Mitchell expressed confidence in the team's ability to respond to adversity.
Chourio reflected on the team's incredible season and their resilience.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at American Family Field with a crowd of 40,350 attendees.
The attendance and game details were provided, including the starting pitchers for the next game.
